text:
Po przelaniu buduje się obfita, drobna i dość trwała piana, sam trunek ma barwę ciemnego mahoniu, prawie czarną, nieprzejrzystą. W zapachu niezwykle przyjemny miks toffi, kakao i wanilii. W smaku nieco powyżej półsłodkiego, intensywne toffi, karmel, krówki, czekolada, kawa espresso i wanilia, delikatna cierpkość i szorstkość od beczki, całość wykończona muśnięciem whisky i średnią, tytoniową goryczką. Dość mocno rozgrzewające, z nisko średnim nagazowaniem, pełne, średnio gęste i delikatnie wyklejające w odbiorze.

Bardzo szlachetny, wykwintny trunek, zdecydowanie deserowy, aczkolwiek nie jest to #teamslodyczka. Mimo wszystko wanilia sprawia, że sączy się to jak jakieś płynne ciasto, co nie było cechą podstawy.
totalnie bourbonowe, dla miłośników stylu, gęste, potężne, wspaniałe, rasowe piwo dla zawodników o mocnych głowach. dla kowbojów, co to nie mogą się zdecydować, czy wolą się żywić whisky, czy piwem.

Zapach wybitny, mega kokos i wanilia do tego sporo czekoladowego likieru. Ogólnie piwo bardzo dobre troszkę pełnia siadła i mogło by mieć zdecydowanie niższe wysycenie. Alkohol troszkę wychodzi ale nie przeszkadza aż tak

Vintage 2009, at City Beer SF. Black color, minimal beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, nuts, dark fruits, chocolate, oak, bourbon, licorice and a bit of bread. Bitter finish with roasted malts, coffee, nuts, dark fruits, wood, chocolate and licorice. Exquisite imperial stout.
12.7 oz. bottle pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma of bourbon and toffee. Taste is bourbon, oak, cherry, chocolate

375ml bottle from Super Deli & Grocery, Seattle. Vintage 2014. Pours an almost black with a brown head. Aroma is bourbon, bourbon barrel, dark fruits, chocolate. Taste is oily with bourbon, chocolate, fruity and some bourbon barrel notes. Still slightly hot, but in a pleasant way. Amazing!
Pours tar black with no head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, vanilla,and wood Thick viscous body with strong bourbon flavor, vanilla, toffee, and hint of wood. Beautiful beer.

Bottle. Aroma is tons of bourbon, vanilla, oak, roasted malt, coconut, chocolate notes. Very dark brown with tan head. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter oak. Full body, oily feel and bourbon bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours pretty flat. Dark brown, near black. Oily in appearance, thin legs. Aromas of bourbon, cardboard, light caramel. Not much going on, to be honest. Taste is a but fuller than the nose lets on, but this seems a bit thin on my palate. Nothing clings or resonates...just fades. Liight vanilla, caramel, toffee. Light raisin, light molasses sweetness. Bourbon takes hold. Finishes with too much heat for the body to handle. Not my thing.

2015 bottle. Pours a thick, oozy brown black, deep and foreboding, with nary a bit of head. Aroma blossoms with heavy toffee and caramel and oak shored up by a massive bourbon backbone. Taste starts with a burst of caramel and molasses, sweet as soft candy and almost as chewy, then grows a dark fruit middle, black cherry and fig and raisin, before the a licorice-tinted finish offers up massive waves of bourbon and oak. So much oak. Might be one of the biggest oak bombs Ive tried, with a lengthy bitter, dry fade more woody and liquor-fueled than a frat boy. Alcohol remains bearable despite the ABV. Never thought it was possible to have too much oak, but this beer pushes my limit. Still, pretty damn enjoyable.

From a bottle. Pours very dark brown with a creamy light brown head. Tastes like rich chocolate malt, smooth booze, ashy wood, and tobacco. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, chocolate malt, ashy wood, and tobacco.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Aus der Flasche getrunken (beim BrewDog-Shop in Ellon gekauft). Sieht aus, wie Altöl, schmeckt aber entscheiden besser....Der Bourbon kommt voll durch. sehr weich und markant.
Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Smak och doft av choklad, bourbon, vanilj, rom-russin, likörpralin. Bra balans, lagom sötma, viss syrlighet, fin beska. Riktigt gott!
Shared 12.7 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon and stone fruit. Taste is bourbon, oak, dark fruits, chocolate, alcohol. Warming finish. Nice.

Aroma: lots of bourbon with some dry mustiness of a traditional stout; Appearance: pitch black with thick tan head that dissipates almost immediately; Taste: follows nose - lots of sweet bourbon with some additional complexity; Palate: very heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: right on the edge of being too bourbony but settles on the right side.
375ml bottle. Black with short brown head. Aroma of dark fruits, baking chocolate, plenty of barrel character. Similar elements in the taste, drinkable, not too sweet. Nice stuff.

Bottle, 375ml. A dark beer with minimal head. Deep aromas iof dried fruits and bourbon. Taste is quite bitter with fizzy carbonation and moderate astringency. Robust bodied, pdense and with a rich mouthfeel. Complex aftertaste full of dried fruits. Very impresive. Almost like an Imperial Stout.

Bottle, 375ml. Opaque dark brown, minimal brown head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark fruits, bourbon. molasses. Full bodied, soft carbonation. Thick and oily. Medium to heavy sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Rich roasted and fruity flavors into a fiery juicy finish. Astounding beer.

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Massor av bourbon som verkligen dominerar smakbilden, men den funkar så bra med den massiva kroppen. Ger stora söta men så bra balanserade smaker av choklad och rom russin och vanilj. Riktigt gott.
Wspaniałość. Tutaj nie ma co się rozpisywać, każdy łyk to feria smaków i aromatów. Jedno z najlepszych piw jakie piłem.
Bottle. Like motor oil this beer pours absolute black, the bourbon barrels ads a party of flavors.

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, klarowny.
Piana: średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, w miarę trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów bourbona, beczki, drewna, intensywne aromaty ciemnych słodów, melasy, wyraźny karmel, czekolada, dość intensywny alkohol, ale nie jest jakiś drażniący.
Smak: średnia pełnia, dość wyraźna słodycz, gładkie, obecne nuty beczki, bourbona, wyraźny karmel, melasa, przypieczone ciasto, trochę czekolady, intensywny alkohol, niezbyt przyjemny, ściągający, wysuszający podniebienie, znacząco potęguje goryczke. Br>
Wysycenie: średnie.

Flaska på muris. Riktig kraftig doft av ekfat o russin med söta inslag. Smaken wow här händer det grejor. Russin in mass med vissa inslag av lite rökig ek. Mmm eftersmaken är såååååå låång. Riktig dessertöl!!! Minska kolsyran så är det en världsöl.

Extrem doft av träfat och fint dessert vin. Smakar JÄVLAR med russin. Ja du Saaaasstans med russin och lite träfat. God jävla extremt fyllig öl. Bra Cigarr öl . Tyvär bubblar det runt i munnen av MASSOR kolsyra????
Butelka z 2009. W aromacie wanilia, czekolada. Smak słodki lekko gorzki, w smaku czekolada, lekko palone, waniliowe, gładkie choć już trochę zanikło ciało. Nadal bardzo dobra rzecz.
2009 vintage. Pięknie się ułożyło, brak oznak złego utlenienia. Bardzo fajna wanilia, czekolada, sporo lukrecji, trochę brakuje ciała.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Older Viscosity (2009) by Port Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaMega zapach, wanilia, lukrecja, migdaly, kokos, czeko, palonosc nawet. Cialo ucieklo po 7 latach, ale smak pycha, analogia do aromatuOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Egész lényéből elegancia, sejtelmesség, fennkölt, emelkedett hangulat sugárzik, kezdve az éjfekete, olajos testére telepedő krémes kávéhabjától vaníliás, mogyorókrémes, diós illatain keresztül, egészen a bársonyos, vaníliás, fahordós ízjegyekig, melyek az érlelés jótékony velejárói. Igazán különleges aromákkal bír, csonthéjas termések puha, süteménytésztás, aranygaluskás, mogyorókávés, mákostésztás, parfümös illathalmaz kenődik szét a levegőben. Mély, strukturált szerkezet ölt testet, prémium ízjegyek formálódnak, vaníliás, kókuszos, kávés, mandulás, bourbon-ös karakter indul útjára, sötét elemek járják táncukat méltóságteljesen, megközelíthetetlen magasztosságban, megfejthetetlen összetettségben. Ízletes, nagyívű, kivételes főzet, lenyűgöző american strong ale.

Bottle, couldnt find the bottling date. Poured to a snifter.

Aroma: vanilla, chocolate, some raisins, soy sauce.

Appearance: pours jet black. Cloudy, with minimal unstable head.

Taste: a lot is going on out here! Heavy sweetness, medium bitterness. Dark chocolate with vanilla infused. A chocolate-vanilla liqeur. Impressive!

Very full bodied. Thick, sticky. Flat carbonation, however seems not to be so (because of the high voltage of alcohol). Very long finish, just like after drinking a liqeur.

This is one of the best things Ive drunk in my life.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 375 ml bottle from Systembolaget. APPEARANCE: deep brown with a small head. NOSE: strong aroma of bourbon, wood, caramel, fudge, brown sugar, bitter chocolate. TASTE: moderatly sweet, long and moderately bitter aftertaste. MOUTH: full body, with a smoth texture. NOTE: wonderful :)

(bottle) clear, bright, very dark brown colour with a small brown head; intense aroma of dried fruit, raisin; intense, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; well hidden alcohol; short lasting carbonation, thickish palate

La même bouteille de 37,5 cl ! A louverture, un énorme parfum de bourbon puis apparaissent au nez dautres odeurs de raisin, de caramel, de chocolat et encore lalcool. En bouche, il y a une explosion de bourbon avec des notes de dattes, de fruits noirs, de chocolat, de café et TOUT ! La chaleur de lalcool persiste ainsi que les saveurs précitées. Je ninvente rien, bien sûr mais cest un MUST pour moi et Sophie aussi avec qui jai partagé le breuvage.
Vom Fass bei Stone in Berlin. Schönes Johannisbeer Aroma. Kokos und Salbei. Weich und total rund! Rum und Rotwein im Antrunk. Röstmalz. Gewürze. Weich und wunderbar abgelagert. Ein Traum!
Bottle #201. Dark brown pour with a small head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate and cherries, beautiful. Taste is cocoa, coffee, chocolate, cherries. Dry finish, incredibly nice. Absolutely gorgeous.
Total black body with a thick beige head.Aromas of coffee,liquorice, vanilla.The taste is coffee,bread,barrel like,alcohol.The aftertaste is bittersweet.

Bottle from 2009 shared by alexsdad06 pour opaque dark brown to black with minimal tan head. Nose Bourbon, boozy, raisin, molasses, and light off. Taste flavors seem thin up front with thick mouth feel, weird. More raisin, and caramel in the aftertaste. Likely much better fresher.

Bottle, bought at Erzbierschof about a year ago, says "vintage 2013 b" on the shoulder. Very, very strong bourbon barrel throughout. There probably *is* an American Strong Ale hiding behind that, but its hard to tell. And so there is not much more to say, except maybe low carbonation, boozy, etc. Nice, but rather one-dimensional.

Pours black with small head nutty malty aroma. Nice strong bourbon flavor with chocolate liqueur aftertaste. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12.7 oz bottle into a snifter. Black, with a thin, light brown head. Quickly dissipating. Aroma is unreal - a ton of the bourbon and barrel initially; some wood/oak. The taste and finish on this is incredible. Havent had a beer like this ever. The alcohol is soft, shining through to highlight the huge chocolate - almost like a milkshake, vanilla, huge toffee, caramel. Soft bitterness, but the flavour goes and goes. I really enjoyed this; cant wait to find a few more of these gems

It pours black with a dark brown head. It has aromas of bourbon, oak, vanilla, and dark chocolate. The vanilla becomes more prominent as the beer warms. There are flavors of bourbon, oak, alcohol, cocoa, dark chocolate, roast, a little bit of burnt, and hints of dark fruit. It is full body with a bit of a slick feel to it. There is strong alcohol warming and the finish is slightly hot. It has low carbonation. Overall this is a strong ale with complex combinations of bourbon, oak, and malts with a slight hop compliment.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 Dark pour with very little carbonation from a 2013 bottle into a snifter glass. It has mild vanilla, bourbon, and the oak barrel aroma. Taste is a mild caramel and vanilla up front that transitions to a smooth bourbon middle and finish. Top 10 beer!

Bottle from FLASK, Aarhus. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, lots of bourbon, dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla. Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Roasted barrel finish. Excellent.

On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is cherries, bourbon, deep dark chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate covered bourbon cherries. Booze is completely hidden. Palate is oily and creamy. Beautifully tangy, sweet without being over the top. A perfect combination of bourbon, cherries and chocolate syrup.

375 ml. Ebony with an enduring thin disc of cream. Aroma is whiskey, tobacco, soy, vanilla, oak and Baby Ruth candy bar. Tastes of all the same stuff, but in the reverse order of strength. Medium-Heavy body is silky smooth with an unobtrusive low-medium carbonation, and a nice balance for a night-cap style brew. I like the blended down Old version a touch better, but this is great stuff.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, bourbon, earthiness, and some chocolate.
Bottleshare at Haket. Black color with black beige foam. Aroma of raisins, caramel, soya, bourbon. Caramel, fudge, bourbon, raisins in taste. Wonderful oily texture and mouthfeel. Wonderful.

Big woody boozy aroma with chocolate mixed in. Black with thin head. Warming, whisky, peat, bitter dark chocolate. Heavy as shit. I guess sludge was the goal right? It really does look like motor oil. Palate is fine rosey whisky. Pixies blasting on the tv, sippin this, nice sometimes to drink a long baby like this instead of a session brew. Even if it is summer this one can be enjoyed anytime. Its been so long since Ive had plain "Old" but Id say this is just as good with a twist nevertheless. Bomb.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2016 Draught. Pours black with a beige/tan head. Aroma of bourbon and chocolate. Tastes of chocolate and scotch with hints of vanilla and a port wine finish. Slight alcohol aftertaste and a thick mouthfeel. Outstanding.

12.7 oz bottle. Pours b;lack with light tan head. Aromas of soggy oak, sharp sweet bourbon, brown sugar, and light roasted malts. Flavors of spicy green oak, lots of bourbon, candi sugar, treacle, dark vanilla, and acidic dark malts. Boozy but really nice.

Draught at Lost Abbey/ Port Brewing Taproom San Marcos, 23.4.16. 2014 vintage. Black with a beige head. Chocolate, port wine and vanilla aroma, deep, bourbon-like taste, with lots of vanilla, sweet, and a little rum even - delicious. Smooth, full-bodied, lingering cocoa-vanilla finish.

Pours black with an inch of khaki foam. Leaves trace lacing in the glass. Nice bourbon and roasted malt on the nose. Big bourbon on the tongue along with sweet malt. Pairs nicely together. Hides the booze well. Nice finish. Excellent imperial stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle vintage 2014 thanks DJ Lovett pours black brown with a nice beige head wonderful lacing. Aromas of earth bourbon oak and chocolate. Taste is amazing bourbon is well integrated into the beer. Notes of chocolate bourbon vanilla full body with a slight alcohol burn. Wow I need to get more of these.

T.J. Thanks for the share of this 375 ml bottle with no bottling date. The color is a opaque black, thin lasting head. Aroma is okay bourbon, chocolate, and earthy hints. 
Flavor is really damn nice. The bourbon is SO nicely integrated into the rich malty backbone. Body is full and the bourbon is smooth with a very minor alcohol burn after the sip. Holy hell, why did I wait this long to try this?? This is amazing. Nobody knows how long this sat around but no matter, totally pimping.

375ml bottle shared by Chalumeaux. Big thanks, TJ! Vintage 2014. Pours used engine oil brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, date, bourbon. Flavor is real nice, super smooth... dark chocolate, dark coffee, bourbron, oak. Great depth and balance. Really good.
Dark brown body with a medium brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, prunes, roasted malt. Taste is heavy sweet and medium to heavy bitter. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full bodied.

Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 15/04/2016
Color negro, espuma beige, aromas alcolicos, sabor torrefacto, notas madera. final seco.
pour black without a head. Lots of oak, and bourbon aromas, with hints of liqurice. taste medium bitter, light sweet. light alkohol feeling in the mouth. full bodied, with soft carbonation.

375 mL bottle shared with ebone1988. This one is a 2014 A vintage. The pour is a lighter black with a nice light khaki colored ring of head that lingers nicely with a little bit of light lace. The aroma is pretty heavy on the bourbon aspect. There is a lot of boozy heat and a pretty strong char. There is a bit of chocolate and a strong alcohol burn. It's pretty surprising. I like the complexity of it. It's pretty great. The flavors are pretty interesting as well. It's got a nice chocolate and bourbon. The boozy heat is probably one of the only complaints I can offer up. There is a nice roasty maltiness that brings it all together. The mouth feel is thick and heavy with a nice soft carbonation to go with a great roasty barrel finish. This one is interesting but there is a ton of barrel character here. It's nice.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Bottle shared with koleminer20. 2014 vintage. Aroma is roasted malt, barrel, booze, smells like a BB Imperial Stout, really good stuff. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, poured thin. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, booze, woody, sweet but bitter, real good. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, woody booze aftertaste. Overall, this one is quite good.

dark brown colour, surprisingly large brown head; aroma of whisky, vanilla and herbal notes, some coffee, hints of smoke, minimal dried fruits and alcohol; taste is the same...to be honest, similarly to Old viscosity, it is definitely not my style - nevertheless, it is probably a perfect and amazing beer, so this must be my fault.

375cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark brown/black with a thin head. Little amount of carbonation and quite an unexpectedly thin mouthfeel. Aroma is neat whiskey with none of that lovely buttery bourbon character a la Deliverance. Massively disappointed with this one. Tastes like a poorly executed imperial stout with cheap bourbon poured in with no balance at all. This is coming from a Port Brewing/Lost Abbey fan boy. Do not understand the hype this beer has.

Thanks to my friend Rob for this one! Cheers man! Une mousse crémeuse dun pouce se forme lors du service et fond malheureusement rapidement sans toutefois disparaître complètement. Me montent au nez les signes évidents dun vieillissement en barriques dun Bourbon chaud et familier. À ces vapeurs boisées et vanillées se joignent des arômes de datte ainsi que dune très subtile torréfaction. Une trace de réglisse rouge peut-être également. Une explosion calorifique de bourbon en bouche! Le liquide est très pétillant, bien aminci par la barrique sans souffrir dune acidité indésirable. Un manque de corps lui fait légèrement défaut à mon avis. Des notes très vanillées qui ici tirent sur le café en grain et le caramel. Se boit très agréablement.

WOW. Aroma is intense dark chocolate, fruits, vanilla, bourbon, alcohol, tar. Flavor is intense sweetness, dark chocolate, roast, Bourbon, malt, soy. Finish is dark chocolate bitter with alcohol burn and lingering sweetness.
Bottle to a tulip. As dark and thick as 30W with a foaming mocha head. Huge Bourbon nose perfectly balanced with toasted malt, vanilla and coffee notes. Sweet boozy finish... Fantastic BBA RIS.

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, brown foamy head. Amazingly rich bourbon nose, sweet roasted malts and vanilla oak in perfect balance. Taste is roasted malty too, vanilla, dried fruits, big velvety bourbon finish, slightly bitter with some leather and smoke. Lingering sweet bourbon finish. Firm body, low carbonation, oily palate.

Las notas son intensas destacando los aromas a Bourbon. 

De color completamente negro, carbonatacion baja, Corona de espuma abundante de baja retención. 

Perfectamente equilibrada en boca.

Sumamente compleja, muy bien balanceada, equilibrada y redonda, algo complejo en una cerveza de 12% ABV, y añejada por 6 meses en barricas de Bourbon.

Una cerveza que se disfruta de principio a fin....

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle from mrburd corked and capped poured into a tulip. Black with small light brown head. Aroma is nice bourbon, medium body, medium carbonation, and thin small-bubble lacing. Taste is bourbon, molasses, vanilla, oak, hints of leather, and dark malt. Good beer.

Trübes dunkel orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen braunen schaumkrone. Geruch sehr holzig, bourbon, Vanille, Eiche, alkoholisch. Geschmack sehr holzig, dunkles malz, Sherry, Eiche, Vanille, bourbon, schokoladig, alkoholisch.
Bottle from etre gourmet I think. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Thick sticky body. Aroma is bourbon, cinnamon, chocolate, roasted, liquorice. Quite warm. Pretty tasty!
Bottle. Black colour with small brown head. Bourbon, oak, roasted aroma. Sweet, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, orasted taste. Medium to full body.

Bottle, 12.0%. Good vanilla aroma. Black colour. Small light brown head. The flavour has a lot of vanilla and alcohol. Some booze in the finish. Actually a lot of booze, quite bitter but not bad at all. Creamy mouthfeel.

Black with small light tan head. Chocolate, dried fruit and light vanilla aroma. Light cocout, bit not sure if its just remains of the previous rating... Strong alcoholic burst almost disguising the malty bourbon flavour. Good.
Color is black with tiny off-white head. Aroma is vanilla, caramel. Taste is sweet, warming with alcohol. A good one.

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy tan head. Clear aroma of barrel and malt, with roasty notes and touchesof coffee and chocolate and lactose. Bitter, roasty flavour with notes of barrel, vanilla and malt. Astringent and slightly acidic aftertaste with boozy and barrellike notes. Very nice. Yummy.

Bottled. Aroma is dark malt and bourbon. Appearance is black with a tan head. Taste is dark fruit with bourbon and dark favors. Palate has some cherry, but mainly fruit. Overall, a good beer that deserves some respect and dignity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from a trade. Nose is moderate booziness with a touch of sherry oxidation. Light dried fruits, figs. Dark brown to black, medium sized, light brown head. Actually laces well. Taste is immediately boozy followed by a string alcohol warming. Second sip shows some licorice, anise, and some more oxidation, but isnt papery. Overall pretty decent. The barrel seems to mask most of the beer though.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2017 Head to head gezet met de Old Viscosity. De Older viscosity heeft een mooiere rondeur/balans en is iets zachter en zoeter.
26/12/2015 Zwarte kleur met weinig schuim. Geur
geroosterde mout, koffie, karamel, Smaak: wat stroperig en romig, gedroogd fruit, bourbon, karamel en vooral koffie. Complex en lekker bier

Bottle pours a black color with a small off white head. Aromas of bourbon, dark fruits, roasted malt. Full bodied very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark syrup, dried fruits and coffee with destintive bourbon notes; oak, tar, smoke. The flavours starts sweet but finish dry with a lasting bourbon booze heat. It is a Full-body beer with a sticky texture. Lively carbonation actually. Intens and good.

Huge and kicking beer even after busy tasting evening. Perfect nose, roast and toast maltiness, vanilla, bourbon, wood notes, light licorice dark choco, dark dried fruits. Vinous and smooth, nicely warming. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Highly enjoyable. Was really impressed as it was late evening..

Pitch black, thick pour, with a dark espresso head that gives way to a thin lacing. Huge bourbon aroma, maple syrup, vanilla, coffee, cocoa. Caramel, maple syrup and bourbon taste up front, followed by dark cherries, some brandy, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, chiles. Soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation (a bit too much for this style of beer) and medium-light body, with a hot and bitter aftertaste, like after eating a chilli dark chocolate.

Bouteille achetée chez Erzbierschof - En garde depuis 2011 - De couleur noir sans mousse - Au nez des arômes de cacao, chocolat, mélasse, noix de coco, vanille, un peu de chêne, légèrement café, une pointe de torréfaction, douce, un nez très complexe, on dirait un dessert, avec une bonne présence de fut de bourbon - En bouche bourbon, chocolat, vanille, coco, biscuit, une pointe dalcool, sucrée - Corp puissant, amertume légère, carbonation plate, douce et soyeuse, final longue coco et chocolat et bourbon - Exceptionnelle cette bière est incroyable, la garde est plus que recommandée, lalcool disparaît prèsque entièrement
Labs un vienkars alus sava stila. Tomer lielisks un sarezgits un komplekss. Novertees kas to saprot

Bottle. Pours black, small head. Aroma of vanilla and chocolate with fruity notes and licorice in the back. In taste sweet with distinct vanilla and coffee flavours backed by medium bitterness and hint of alcohol. Oily in texture, softly carbonated. Very well done.

Bottle at home. 2014 vintage. Aroma is lots of vanilla, chocolate, lots of Bourbon, malt, oak, dried dark fruits, raisins, liquorice, caramel. Flavour is sweet, body is full, a bit creamy texture. Massive Bourbon and vanilla, heavy but for its ABV this is fairly easily drinkable. Smooth and creamy, rich and complex. Delicious.
Bottle. Color black with medium white head. Aroma malt, roasted, chocolate, caramel, alcohol. Taste sweet, bitter, malt, alcohol, chocolate, liqourice.

Bottle. Beermoth, Manchester. Clear, very dark brown. Thin, very dense, sticky, tan head. Aroma of cherry chocolate truffle. New leather. Sugar loaded espresso. Big, woody booze. Saline, and savoury notes. Overall, rich and decadently boozy. Taste is thick sweet. Turns woody dry, and soft, roast bitter. Smooth body. Silly easy drinking. Finishes rich, salty, chewy, roasty, boozy bitter. Huge beer. Delicious.

Bourbon, light vanilla and some dark chocolate. Pours jet black and syrupy with quickly dissipating mocha head. Bitter and astringent finish with some caramel. Not really my thing. Bottle from julios liquors.

I consider this a Barleywine. May also call this a Strong Ale. Black as night with a tan creamy head. Oakie bourbon subtle sweet nose. Front pallet has smooth palate with a sweet malt with molasses taste and a bittersweet back pallet that warms the throat.

Bottle. Blackish pour. Strong aroma of raisins, dates, vanilla, anise and whiskey. Taste is similar to the nose. Palate is full. Finishes long and satisfying. Decent. Paired well with some aged Scottish cheddar cheese.
Bottle. Thick layer of malt, vanilla and coffee. Full body, slick mouthfeel. Estery, giving way to subtle booze, with some licorice in the finish. Light woody notes throughout. Excellent.

11/11/2009 11:11:22 AM Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark brown body with tan head. Nice malty nose with caramel and plenty of bourbon. Taste of caramel, whisky, malts and bourbon. Really nice and thick. Syrupy. Nice one.

Bottle @ home. Aged 4 years. Dark brown with no head at all. Sweet and perfectly vinous aroma with chocolate, raisins, dates, bourbon vanilla & oak. Backing cocoa, leather and licorice, warming alcohol. Thick, sweet and big bodied palate with no carbonation. Flavors of cocoa, caramel, scorched sugar, toffee, licorice, dates, oak, vanilla and figs. Warming, well integrated alcohol in mid taste. Nice quite dry finish with coffee like bitterness and lingering licorice, nuts, leather and dried dark fruits. A little astringent banana peel feeling (but no taste of banana) in the aftertaste coupled with alcohol and hints of butterscotch.

Bottle. Pours black with brown head. Aroma is intense dark chocolate, fruits, vanilla, bourbon, alcohol, tar. Flavor is intense sweetness, dark chocolate, roast, Bourbon, malt, soy. Finish is dark chocolate bitter with alcohol burn and lingering sweetness. Overall: great brew.

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks. Pitch black beer, small brown head. Nose is vanilla, roast, tar, soy sauce, bourbon, oak. Flavor is smooth roast, oak, soy sauce, vanilla, bourbon. Finishes with soy, roast, booze and bourbon, peat. The finish is really close to drinking actual bourbon and/or scotch because of the alcohol, vanilla and peat. Still, a nice sipper.
33cl bottle, thanks to k0mpsa. Deep dark brown color with slight white head. Really rich nose with loads of aromas like dirt and spices. Tight rich dry palate. Lenghty finish with loads of flavour.
Bottle. Black color, brown head. Nice aroma has vanilla, bourbon, oak, chocolate, very balanced. Coffee, roasty, lot of chocolate, vanilla notes.

22/08/2015  sample (bottle) @ Gents Bierfestival shared with JorisPPattyn, Sebletitje, 77ships & PriorL
Black colour, no head.Coffee, bourbon, vanilla, some caramel. Oily, smooth.

(Thx! for sharing) Sampled 375 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2015. Very dark brown with no head, doesnt appear to be carbonated. Nose is oxidation with big boozy bourbon, thick sweet malt, barrel & oak is huge, vanilla & even more bourbon on top of bourbon with malts. Taste is oxidized bourbon syrup, warming, light leaves, huge oak, vanilla, sugar, caramel syrup, malts, Flat. Might have been a touch better with a touch less oxidation & some carbonation but a great beer still if you love malts, barrel & a lot of bourbon in your beer.
Bottle at Gents Bierfestival. Very thick, oily, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, alcohol. Nice but a bit extreme.
Pours black with a small tan head. Flavor is malty with a strong feel of bourbon. Not a very easy drink with its high alcohol content but very enjoyable nonetheless. Outstanding.
Bottle. Poured a near pitch black color with a very small head. Aroma was roasted malts, smooth bourbon notes, vanilla. Some coffee and chocolate hides in there. Alcohol is there. Oh its there.

vanilla, woody, chocolate, roasty, coffee, nuts, alcohol, licorice, soy sauce, raisin, rich and rewarding! 
Black colour, medium Brown head, lacing.
Heavy, heavy sweetness, salty, acidic, medium bite, lots of lovely bourbon-notes, lots of chocolate and licorice, ABV evident, but not boozy. 
Velvety Smooth, oily, fullbodied to say the least, soft carbonation, warming finish.
A tad too sweet, but a world class treat!

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is prunes, leather, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, caramel, overripe fruits. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is bourbon (surprise), overipe fruits.

I was happy to get my hands on this. Not every day I get to rate a 100/100 beer. Expensive for sure ($15-16 for a 12.7 oz. bottle) so it better be worth it. Aroma is heavy oak barrel, prune and other dark fruit, leather and plenty of booze. Appearance is a 5 right out of the gate. Pitch black, thick and virtually free of any foam. The tiny amount of foam the beer does have is a light tan color. It really does look like old motor oil. Tastes almost sour, raisin like at first, but then oak, roast, milk chocolate and coffee flavors take over, leaving a warming finish. Let this beer warm up a bit as it brings out the oak flavors even more.

Bottle to tulip
Chocolate, nutmeg, and booze. Dark brown with no head. Chocolate and bourbon,
Bottle - Lots of bourbon and barrel Woody notes. Jet brown with a nice brown head. Lots of sweet Woody barrel notes. Not as hot as expected but, but lots wood.

12.7 fl oz bottle. Black colour, tan foam head and aroma of dark fruits, woody oak, bourbon, molasses, chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, roast malt, sweetish, oaky vanilla, boozy bourbon, earthy and spicy bitter. Oily mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, dry warming finish with roasted & dark chocolate notes. Nicely drinkable.

On tap at the brewery. Black color with nice and stable tan ring. Dark malts, motor oil, sweet and not sweet at the same time, crazy viscosity. Vanilla, bourbon, etc. Just like the Old Viscosity on steroids. Hard to imagine that one can take this so far. Amazing intensity!
Flaska på bishops, Linköping. Doft av Bourbon, vanilj, torkade frukter och kola. Mjuk och len smak av detsamma plus en värmande alkohol. Mycket god!
Bottle @ ZEBF 2015. Thick oily black pour. Aroma of chocolate and vanilla mostly. Taste is extremely rich, with lots of oaky vanilla, chocolate and a milky creamy touch. Fantastic.
On tap at the Red Hot. Black, thin tan head. Scent is alcohol, black licorice. Taste is pretty boozy. Bourbon, black licorice, roasted malts. Tasty!

375ml bottle, 2010 vintage, deep abyssal dark color, with no head, nice mild bourbon, light vanilla, black chocolate, brownie nose, with some faint grated coconut, light dark coffee, chocolate pie, roasted, chocolate, toasted malt accents and an oak barrel, light chocolate chip cookie dough, faint dark bitter chocolate baking bar, chocolate cup filled with bourbon note in the aroma with a full-bodied palate, with a light syrupy, warmth good mild bourbonish, sweet dark bitter chocolate, chocolate pie character, with some smooth vanilla oak barrel, burnt fruitcake, sweet roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malty, ice coffee flavours, leading towards a mild warming chocolatey, dark bitter chocolate, could coffee, sweet roasted, chocolate, toasted maltiness, lingering bourbonish finish.

Negro opaco y giste beis compacto y muy duradero. Aromas de bourbon, cacao, frutos rojos vainilla y tostados muy intensos. Cuerpo medio alto, inicio dulce, con presencia evidente de bourbon, pasas, vainilla y frutos rojos. El final es de un amargor intenso que contrasta bien, muy tostado.
2011 bottle from a few years back via notes. Pours a jet black with tiny tan head. Aroma is coffee and tobacco. Taste is roasted coffee beans, chocolate and vanilla.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: sampler that poured almost black with smallish mocha head. the aroma was heavenly. dark roasted malts and chocolate, booze, oak, vanilla, deep and true. the flavors held most of the same absolutely wonderful. nice boozey note to it...blended with the malts and chocolate, oak, vanilla, be still my beating heart.
Dark pour with liw tan head. Chocolate, coffee, caramel, coconut, vanilla and hints of spirits. High body

Someone I know thought it was humorous that I said I was raging to try this beer, but Im telling you that every time I saw the bottle my taste buds would start doing jumping jacks to get ready...in case I decided to make the leap.This beer comes with a rep.
The cork comes free with a practiced wrist and a coaxing tug, releasing the aroma immediately and allowing my watering mouth a suggestive tease. I tip the glass and pour slowly, watching the thick, black-walnut flow broach the rising head; a foam the color of dark mocha, deep, wet and soft. The thick cap vanishes into a swirling galaxy on the surface in a matter of minutes.
The aroma is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, becoming more heady and aromatic over the course of the review. I tip the glass and pull the brew slowly through my mouth, feeling the cool liquid find its way beneath the soft undersides of my tongue, stinging it just a touch. Dark, bourbon-soaked, over-ripe fruits come alive in the flavor and accent the dark chocolate perfectly, the vanilla still very apparent in the aroma and adding a mellow groove to the experience. The heavy body is a bit oily, not sticking to my tongue, but glancing over it, the carbonation is soft and the finish only long enough to make me think I should have bought another bottle.
Really intense, abv shows itself in abundance. Vanilla, toffee, caramel, anise, very carbonated. Not worth the extreme premium
8 oz glass from the East side. Dark, thick and black. Strong bourbon aroma with molasses, vanilla and oak. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Smooth!
2010 vintage. pours dark brown color with coffee head. The aroma is roasted barley blended with chocolate. The flavor is caramel and alcohol. Drinkable given its strength.

On tap at Stong Ale Fest - 2015. Pour is deep black with a small brown head and decent lacing. Dark chocolate, coffee, some vanilla, wood, bourbon, toffee, raisins, and prunes in the aroma. Taste is Big raisins, figs, brown sugar, dates, lots of bourbon, caramel malty, and somewhat vinous. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Strong bourbon notes with the oak, vanilla, and some chocolate coming through too. Real nice dark brown color accented by the reddish amber hue along the edges. Not much in the way of a foam cap but spotty slight lacing is there. Beautiful bourbon flavor intertwined with oak, vanilla, and cocoa. Pretty full bodied on the palate with a creamy feel finishing with some heat. Absolutely wonderful whiskey barrel aged stout!

Massive beer. Its in a characteristic profile thats not to my personal taste - lots of dark ripe fruits like dates, raisins, figs, plus molasses with very dark/black malts/grains. Luckily I could pick up a bit of roasty dryness to balance it a touch, not nearly enough, but it helped.

Bottle shared at Anchorage Feb 15 Tasting: Poured a black brown with a bubble head. Aroma was coconut, bourbon, and nice sweetness. Taste was an alcohol burn with vanilla, bourbon, and dark fruit. Super hot!

Bottle. 2011 vintage. 

A: Pure black with a ring of mocha head. Good lacing. 

N: Bourbon, vanilla, caramel, coconut, cocoa, dark cherry, prune, red velvet cake. 

T: Very sweet. Hint of tartness. 

M: Heavy, oily body, fuzzy carbonation, alcohol hits the nose.

O: A fine, viscous beer. The bourbon aging is excellent. Could use a touch more body, bit otherwise, well worth ones time.

Tasted from draft. Pours black with dark brown head. Aroma is sweet with bourbon and caramel notes as well as some dark fruits. Taste is very complex. Bourbon flavor with caramel, syrup, dark fruits, oak, toffee, vanilla and some toasty notes. Excellent and complex beer that hides the alcohol very well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Láhev 355 ml. Aroma je naprosto ultimátní, autenticky kokosové obalené v kvalitní mléčně čokoládě s nádechem jemné whiskey a dubu v pozadí. Pěna je hnědá, jemná, nízká a nedrící. Barva samotného piva je téměř neprůsvitná rubínová. Chuť je lahodná a bohatá, je v ní znát kokos, mléčná a hořká čokoláda, dubové silice a to celé je prostoupené jemnou whiskou, díky čemu tato chuť pravidelně přechází do jemně čokoládově hořkého finie v doprovodu alkoholové palčivosti. V ústech pivo působí mohutně, má střední říz a i přesto je dobře pitelné. Tohle pivo mě absolutně odpálilo, je to snad to nejlepí co jsem doposavaď měl a upřímně na delí dobu asi zůstane, aroma tohoto piva je jednodue grandiózní a o chuti nemluvě, je to nádherná plejáda pestré chuti silných piv, perfektně vybalancovaná a dokonalá, tohle je opravdu nezapomenutelná zkuenost.

Delicious foamhead! Very complex, soft, viscosey and deep malt beverage! Slight bourbon peppery hints, vanilla, cassis in the far background, lots of brown chocolate aromas. Mouthfeel is stunning. A lot of depth in the taste profile; Heaven Hill (a lot more than the Rasputin HH BA from De Molen!) Kentucky whiskey, vanilla, cane sugar in the middle, slight fizzy on the tongue in the aftertaste. I get lots of brown chocolate and raisins in the after too. Loveeeee this! Long lasting heat on the palate... and stomach.

Poured 2010 bottle. Pitch black, sweet bourbon, fruity smell. Love the taste of oak barrel bourbon taste that is so clear, with a smoky aftertaste. Not so much mouthfeel as I would have wanted. But overall a great beer. Not great, awesome!

Pours pitch black with a half finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of bourbon, woody notes, dark fruits, molasses, coffee, dark coco, vanilla, and a little booze. Taste is about the same as the aroma with the addition of some butterscotch, and mild hop bitterness. Has a medium-full body with a creamy, warming, slightly boozy, medium-long finish. Overall, a excellent strong ale that borders on imperial stout territory.
Tap at Toronado, Seattle. Colour is black with small brownish head white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate, dark chocolate and roasted malts. Very heavy stuff.

(375ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Feb 6 2015) Pours basically black with a small tan head fading quickly to a ring. Aroma has lots of bourbon spirit notes, some vanilla/wood too, some pretty intense fudge/toffee malts, almost creamy, fruity prune-type notes, a bit of nutty toasted malt too. Palate loaded with malt, toffee/fudge/raw sugar/milk chocolate/toast, and also lots of bourbon flavour. Vanilla oak and prunes as well, fleshing it out and giving just a little fruit acidity. Quite sweet overall but with some spicy whiskey alcohol heat towards the finish drying it out, and subtle roast too for bitterness. Full bodied, creamy and oily, with soft but active carbonation. Big big beer. Warming and maybe a touch too sweet to be really drinkable. Total sipper. Hides its alcohol well. Its definitely a good one, but really calls for a cold night and a fire.
Lightly fruity with plums, raisins and burned sugar, very little toasted malts and a decent bourbon oakiness to it, a bit vanilla, wood, and alcohol is a bit too forward, in general its very thin.

Pours an average light brown frothy head that slowly diminishes. Body is black some sparkles are viible at the surface of the glass.
Aroma contains moderate malts (dark bread, hay, caramel milk chocolate, roasted and toasted malts, nuts and strong coffee), light hops (pine, grass, orange zest), light yeasts (barnyard, leather) and grape, raisin, bourbon, pine apple, cask wood, peach and other sweet fruits,spices, banana, vanilla and apple.
flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and sweet,followed by sweet (and bourbon), sweet and light bitter, sweet and bitter and finishing in espresso bitter and bourbon.
Body is full with syrupy texture and soft carbonation.
subtle, balanced and complex with bourbon coming through from time to time. The way I like it.

dense beige head leaves structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is coconut, bit of onion, very boozy, vanilla. taste like aroma, lots of coconut with a long bitter finish. quite dense mouthfeel, quite carbonated.
2010 shared by Marcus. Pours black with no head. Taste is Carmel with that old beer raisin flavor. Drinks smooth

Bottle split 5 ways as part of Dangerous Bottleshare 5.0. Jet black pour with a tiny tan head. Loads of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, some soy sauce and light licorice. Hides the ABV pretty good. Tasty stuff!

Couleur entre ambre foncé et noir, mousse jaunâtre peu épaisse, nez sur le café et la vanille bien sûr, mais aussi un côté viandé, de la cerise aigre comme dans une Rodenbach et des fruits noirs. Bouche puissante, pas très concentrée, mais avec une belle ampleur, sur les arômes du nez, un peu damertume, jamais trop lourde. Longue finale.

Bottle, 12.7fl oz (whatever that may mean), vintage 2011. Pours pretty viscous as promised, black with absolutely no head. Aroma is spicey bourbon, vanilla, malted milk biscuit, custardy, maybe a touch of oxidation. Body is medium to big, very smooth, low carbonation. Taste is also very smooth, chocolate and vanilla, sweet malt, oaky, tangy dark fruit, a little sharp bourbon booziness towards the end. Very good. I never thought Id say this...but maybe its too big.  Reminds me of some big sweet barley wines Ive had.  Too much for one person - doesnt leave you wanting more!

Sample at semi-S&G tasting (since the music was shut down halfway through).
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, coffee, alcohol, caramel.
TASTE: toffee, chocolate, coffee, alcohol warming feeling.

Pours black, smallish tan head that dies quickly. Nose of whiskey, boozy heat, toffee, fudge, vanilla, milk chocolate, prunes. Tastes huge sweet milk chocolate, toffee, prune, cocoa, vanilla oak, whiskey, molasses, muscovado, some moderate roast bitterness and slightly dry finish. Full body, creamy slick feel, softish carb, long molasses and light acid roast finish. Nice; a trifle sweet but good complexity, lots of whiskey character.
Bottle from Cervezorama Madrid. Thinner than anticipated. Big oak, bourbon, vanilla. Pretty sweet. Little over-fizzy but a minor grumble. Oily. Very nice very large.

En retirant le bouchon de liège de la Older Viscosity, de puissantes effluves alcoolisés ont explosé de la bouteille. En respirant le dessous dudit bouchon... oh boy. Ça promet.
De fines bulles en parcimonie sur la surface dun liquide dun noir impénétrable font office de mousse.
La magie commence à opérer dès les premières inspirations. Du gros bois imbibé de bourbon, du cacao et de la réglisse noire. Pas de finesse ici, juste une lourdeur olfactive me pressant dy tremper mes lèvres.
En bouche, une vague de chaleur alcoolisée et sucrée rafle tout, ramassant au passage des saveurs vanillées et chocolatées. Pour couper tout ça, des tannins féroces gracieuseté du bois des barriques percent le tout et sétalent langoureusement en finale.
Je suis subjugué par la décadence hautement satisfaisante de cette bière conçue par les Californiens de Port Brewing / The Lost abbey.

shared 37,5cl bottle with a friend. 2013 version. poured a pitch oil black colour with a small mocha coloured head. sweet dark bakers chocolate, fudge, oak, bourbon, vanilla, roasted malts, dark espresso beans, caramel, toffee, spicy booze nose, was expecting a bit more complexity, but its still very smooth. recommended to share your bottle.

Bottle to glass. Pours a thick pitch black color with a creamy light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, molasses, touch of bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate. Flavor has a huge bourbon character, with lots of vanilla, molasses, and roasted malts. Medium to heavy body with a thick creamy mouthfeel and a lingering vanilla and light chocolate. Extraordinary!

Bottle. 2011 vintage. Black and viscous with a small layer of mocha head. Aroma is milk chocolate, vanilla, oak, very spirits forward. Taste is light bitterness up front, toward the middle the flavour explodes with hints of vanilla, oak, and chocolate. Finish is smooth with a spirit like aftertaste, full bodied, plenty of carbonation. Very well integrated stuff. Excellent.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Exactly what it says. Bourbon is not over powering. But it does bite going down a Little. Rich deep color and beautiful head coloring. Would have again. Tap

Backlog rating. 375ml bottle from Beers of Europe. It pours a deep dark brown color with almost no head to speak of. Just a small ring of beige bubbles around the sides of the glass. Aroma is big bold and complex with notes of boozy bourbon, oak chips, vanilla pod, milk chocolate shake, toffee pudding, roasted coffee beans, dates marmalade. Taste is big sweet and bold with more bourbon, wood, leather, vanilla, chocolate fudge, red berries compote, toffee. Finishes estery, with notes of port wine, mildly bitter and dry. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, a big bold bourbon monster, I liked it quite a lot

Bottle at Lost Abbey in Escondido. Pours dark brown. Aroma is oak and dark fruits. Really fantastic. Holy cow amazing stuff really really great. Not much else to say. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black pour with tan head. Aroma is roast chocolate malt with alcohol. Taste is roast chocolate malt, molasses and brown sugar. Great beer.

A pleasant backing of bourbon rounds out the bouquet with a rich quantity of caramel and vanilla tones. Full bodied, syrupy mouthfeel with a silky texture. Sweeter and more vinous that the regular run of Old Viscosity.

Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with some sediment and a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, and dark fruits - with a bitter finish.

11/15/14 3rd beer of the night at Bar-Ly on tap. Always wondered about this one but always way too expensive. Turned out it was only $7.50 on tap. 
Super beer. Everything you'd want in a BA beer. Probably top 5 in the style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Huge bourbon, vanilla and chocolate aromas. Nice black pour with little head or foam. The taste is a bit more subdued with marshmallow and vanilla mixed with a sweet thick malt. Really good but a bit lacking in depth.

Dark dark brown, almost black. Nice off white head. Raisiny aroma with huge notes of vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Heavy on the tongue, lively carbonation, hints of boozy chocolate cake. This is good stuff.
Botella. Presencia impoluta. Con aroma a leche café y licor. En boca es compleja y entra de luxe. Muchas notas de madera, licor, café. Una cerveza redonda aunque cara
Black colour. Vanilla oak, bourbon, chocolate aroma. Tastes delicous, bourbon, sweet, chocolate

September 13, 2014. Bottle, vintage N/A. Pours dark brown with almost no head, just a small tan ring. Aroma is bourbon, oak, vanilla, milk chocolate, figs. Taste is light bitter chocolate, medium sweet caramel, dried fruits. Finish is vinous and dry woody notes with figs, bourbon and chocolate. Medium to full bodied with very soft carbonation.

aroma: coffee, vanilla, some marshmallow. appearance: dark brown body with espresso colored head. decent lacing. taste: sweet vanilla, some harsh/astringent floral coffees. little bit of fudge. palate: lively carb...creamy texture. full bodied.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 375ml corked bottle served im a snifter glass.
Vintage 2011.
A; Pours a deep brown brown color which is almost black. Practically no head and very few lacings left
S: Very strong smell of oak and bourbon. Strong notes of roasted malts too. Boozy. 
T: Sweet upfront. Strong notes of wood and bourbon. Roasted malts. End is boozy and slightly bitter
M: Heavy and creamy body. Oily. Low carbonation. Oak and bourbon aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability despite the high ABV. Excellent quality beer.
[ BA Review @ 5/27/2013 ]

he look is close to advertised...30 weight motor oil, with a touch of head. aroma is sweet bourbon, oak, chocolate, alcohol & coffee. mouthfeel is slick, although just a touch thinner than expected. the flavor is a mix of bourbon, oak, molasses, sweet malt, and some chocolate & coffee. Overall, it was very good, but not quite as complex as I was hoping for. Bourbon fans will love it...I liked it a lot, but at the price, even Bourbon County Stout @$5+ for a 12 oz bottle is a better deal. 7/11 - a couple rturn trips to this beer and i upped it a tenth. old vis is a better deal (more beer for less) but i do like this one more."

Bottle. Pours like used motor oil, thick, very little head, no bubbles. Huge Oak, wood, alcohol nose, dark overripe plumb. Strong warm alcohol taste, wood, and roast and brown sugar notes. Very smooth for such a strong beer.

12.7fl oz bottle @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 09-02-2014.
Courtesy of Andrés Lúpulo.
In short: mighty dark ale.
Pours black with some tan head. Poor head retention, some lacing. Wood, sweet, liquor, caramel, nuts aromas. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is smooth, liquor, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, wood flavours. Really smooth, well balanced and enjoyable.

Served on-tap at Als of Hampden into a Bells tulip.


A - Pours jet black with a small half finger tall java colored head, dissipating down to a thin film, leaving spotty sheets of lacing down the glass.


S - Quite a bit of bourbon up front mixes with some sweet chocolate, vanilla, oak/wood, dark roasted malt, and a bit of booze. Pretty well balanced even with all those flavors competing for the lead.


T - Plenty of chocolaty sweetness up front giving way quickly to a mix of bourbon heat, vanilla, and dark roasted malts. Finish is a bit hot with plenty of lingering sweet roast. Nice balance of base flavors and the woody bourbon from the barrel. Very good stuff.


M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sweet, roasty, heat both in the feel and the finish.


D - Pretty high all things considered. I have always liked this beer. The combo of dark stout and bourbon is really nice. The only drawback is the high ABV. as it really does prevent you from enjoying multiple servings.
Dark beer, bourbon, vanilla, oak, alcohol. Even though I find it an amazing beer, its not a style I enjoy having in large portions. Its like an excellent alcoholic beverage,
Black colour, no head. Aroma of bourbon , oak, vanilla, molasses, cocoa, coconut, rasins. Taste is slightly sweet, light bitter. Medium body, oily texture, flat carbonation. Quite bourbon-y

375 ml bottle poured into a snifter. Black with a finger of brown head, slight brownish hue on the edges. Aromas of bourbon, chocolate, oak, a bit of licorice. Tastes of bourbon, dark fruit, chocolate, oak, light caramel/syrup. Full body with a dry and slightly warm finish. Oily, creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Nice stuff.

Bottle shared thanks to Tim and Rachel at Proof happy hour! Pours a motor oil black with little to no head or lacing. Aroma is big on the sweet bourbon barrel goodness, vanilla, oak, chocolate. Taste follows, smooth and rich, thick and chewy. Great barrel qualities, very nice.
Tap, dark pour, brown head, nose is coffee, taste is coffee, caramel, sweet, rich, vanilla, awesome.

Black with rich creamy light brown head. Such a luscious aroma. Rich smooth dark malty. Caramel, toffee, brown sugar, vanilla, dark chocolate, smooth bourbon barrel. Thick, full, rich body. Warms the body. Soft. Plenty of booze but doesnt get in the way. Moderate bittersweet. Not overly sweet, bitter, or roasty. Great balance. Lots of great bourbon.
Aroma of wood, vanilla and some chocolate. The taste is similar. Very low carbonation. A little astringent in the finish. A little to woody.
Ohh, super sweet like candy, decadent. Super smooth, rich, creamy, like an expresso ( the roastiness) yum!

Black pour, moderately frothy brown head. Fudge, caramel, bourbon, sweetened coffee, light vanilla. Bittersweet with a longer, black coffee finish. Smooth, gentle carb, but a bit thinner than expected. Some booziness there but well masked.
Black with tiny tan head. Strong aromas of chocolate and bourbon. Chocolatey flavor with a strong alcohol finish. Very smooth.
Thick black pour, tiny head, lower carb. Big bourbon and anise aroma. Taste of bourbon, dark chocolate, anise, vanilla. Full body. Slick mouthfeel.

From a bottle. Pours a dark chocolate brown making a light brown 1 finger head. Smells of chocolate and bourbon. Very boozy. Very syrupy. Lots of tiny bubbles. Tastes like a chocolate/vanilla cognac. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bue en bouteille. Sublime produit ! Couleur noir profond, pas deffervescence. Explosion darômes en bouche, boisés, vanillés... Génial !

Bottle from the Beer Temple, kind of pricey. Poured thick black with decent dark tan head. Bourbon vanilla forward aroma which I like, oak booze choc vanilla. Light carb med bod. Alchy bourbon tinge with vanilla. Aromas better then taste.
Bottle at home. Strong vanilla smell, tastes sweet, vanilla, chocolate, light toffee.

Bue en bouteille de 37.5, couleur noire pétrole, pas de mousse ni deffervescence, nez complexe sur le côté bois de chêne et la vanille, en bouche cest ultra puissant, ça commence avec le café, puis le café au lait et ensuite gros côté grillé très noir et une fin de bouche longue sur le rhum ambrée et le bourbon vanillé, Tuerie extrême !

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a black/brown hue, with a frothy, brownish tan head that gradually diminished to a ring & film, and wavy cling to the lacing. The nose was bourbon at the ready, with some roastiness, blanketed by chocolate, and dark fruit as prune & raisin. Full bodied, with notes as the aromas, soft carbonation, some silkiness to the mouthfeel, and very warming alcohol.

Bottle from Vestergaard. Ty <'3 Pours jet black with a dense offwhite thin shortlasting head. Nose is VERY bourbon, slight booze. Very smooth. Raisins, toffee. Taste is very sharp up front. Sharp roast, raisins, booze. Aftertaste is dry, sweet dark fruits and lots of bourbon.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2015 Bottle. Pours pitch black with a tiny, light brown head. Aroma has heavy bourbon, toffee, slight roast, vanilla. Taste has more roast and a sharper alcohol. Coffee, toffee, bourbon. I donât get how this is not a stout, but itâs a lovely beer!

375 ml bottle into snifter, vintage 2013A bottling. Pours dense pitch black color with a small fairly dense tan head with poor retention, that reduces to a ring of lacing fairly quickly. Some slight spotty lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, raisin, prune, caramel, toast, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, and roast/oak earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, caramel, toast, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, raisin, prune, and roast/oak earthiness. Slight roasted bitterness/spicy alcohol on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, roast, caramel, toast, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak, and roast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity and robustness of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; with an awesome malt/barrel balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very creamy and lightly slick/chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is fairly well hidden with only a small warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome barrel aged imperial stout. All around great complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle, unknown vintage. Delightfully rich bourbon aroma with a hint of chocolate and alcohol. Pours jet, inky black like motor oil with a thin light brown head and not a lot of lacing. Thick, inky mouthfeel with sweet dark fruit and chocolate flavors to start. Then, we get to the wonderful finish with nice bourbon undertones with just a touch of alcohol. The overall flavor of the beer lingers deliciously on the palate. Fantastico!

2010 vintage on tap at the Brick Store Pub 17th Anniversary. Pours black, with a thin head. the aroma is milk chocolate, black cherries, caramel, and toffee. Nice, candy sweetness, with a mild, pleasant sourness. Medium to heavy body, oily, and a little watery. This keg mightve been a little infected, but it was still delicious.

bottle from homer, many thanks brody. pours dark, no head. at first appearance seems flat.big surprise, i know. nose is full of bourbon, mild chocolate. taste begins with light sweetness, chocolate, pitted fruit, then onslaught of bourbon. full body. the lack of carb works in its favor, keeps everything lingering.
Black pour, big brown head. Huge aroma of whiskey, oak and candied fruits. Great flavor of alcohol, whiskey, and chocolate. Full bodied. Fantastic.

How: Bottle.
Where: From Dranken Geers, had in a hotel room at Grand Hotel, Stockholm.
Appearance: Black colour with a small tan head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, coffee.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Coffee, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate.

12.7 bottle was purchased by Dreadnaught33 in Costa Mesa, CA in February, 2013. Pours black with a decent head and great lacing. Aroma is bourbon, rich creamy stout, buttery and sweet. Flavor is creamy, buttery stout with a very prominent bourbon component. Alcohol is present, but the beer is not overly boozy. Chocolate finish.
Tastes really good with a smooth caramel sweet flavor aroma. Has a fizzy palate with a slight hop bitter long finish. Dark amber brown in color.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2014 Appearance= oil. Pitch black, nothing escaping at all. Not much head, just a mocha coloured rim around the edge. Alcohol legs definitely detectable. Aroma- vanilla, leather hints, a bit of coffee but more chocolatey , burnt sugar, toasted coconut, bitter chocolate, bourbon, boozy, cocoa hints, fudge. Smells lovely. Taste- intense, and big flavours hit you. Lots of chocolate, burnt treacle, the bourbon then comes through with vanilla hints, plenty of bitterness, chocolate fudge cake, sticky and slightly oily mouthfeel, with some alcohol warmth- you can tell its a big beer. The finish lingers for ages and clings to the mouth. Some espresso characteristics towards the end. Very viscous (unsurprisingly). The carbonation is quite soft, and maybe a bit more would help things along, but this is pretty much the only criticism. This is a superb brew.

2012 bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Pours black with a very thin lace of beige head that disappears fast. Amazing aromas of oak, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate and coffee. Taste is also fantastic with vanilla from bourbon in the front and oak and chocolate to follow strong. Licorice and full bodied. Bittersweet aftertaste and low carbonation. Really amazing brew !!!

4yr old bottle, 2010. Pours very dark with a brown mocha head that quickly dissolved. The aroma is of oak, carmel malts, vanilla, and a medium intensity of sweet bourbon booze. The older viscosity has a very good aroma. Tasting this brew I noticed a pleasant bourbon flavor with mild chocolate notes, vanilla, sugary carmel sweetness, soft dark fruit character, and a nice lightly roasted malt taste. The finish has a bitter sweet flavor that is overwhelmed by a pleasant boozy taste. Overall this is a very solid beverage and I enjoyed the barrel aged version over the old viscosity but just slightly. I would have this beverage again.

Pours black with a thin tan head. 

Aroma of bourbon and some chocolate. 

Bourbon comes first on the taste and is followed by dark chocolate and a surprising faint tartness at the end. More chocolate on the finish. 

Some carbonation and a long lasting mouthfeel. This is a good one.

Almost like a BBA stout, but with some slight differences. This is a fantastic beer. The tartness is perfectly balanced with the chocolate and bourbon. I could drink a bunch of these. Glad I randomly decided to grab the last bottle at my local bottle shop.
On tap at Falling Rock. Black appearance. Roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, oak, bourbon, vanilla and coffee. Pretty dank.

Poured at a tasting, a black with little head on the sides of glass, minimal to no lace. The aroma is fantastic, the bourbon oak being the biggest of a complex aromas. Vanilla, roasted malts and licorice being others. The taste was bourbon and licorice with oak and vanilla. This was a heavy thick one, perfectly named, and warming in the finish. Fantastic.

Black, tan head. Big thick viscous mouthfeel with deep malt character of dark bread, licorice, roast, caraway seeds, nutty notes, big bourbon barrel character. Huge and complex and aptly named. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2014 2013 vintage from Jerrys, Chicago. Black, no head, motor oil pour. Big bourbon quality to aroma. Taste is bourbon, but though sweet not sickly on finish. As it warms the abv comes out far more clearly. Also the flavours are a touch medicinal which is off-putting. Finish is a mild bitter astringency and bourbon. Nice beer, better than the base product, but still a little dull sadly.

Very dark and heavy, like the bottle says, "not your dad's 30 weight!".

No head, barrel flavor forward with sweet mouthfeel. Nice aftertaste. Not to smokey. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, and toasted malts. A creamy deep brown pour with a tan ring and limited lacing. The taste isAMAZING! Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, hints of dark fruit, and oak. Full body and medium carbonatin. Rich, creamy mouthfeel. Overall, this is an exceptional beer. It has it all, a complex palate and a full bodyied creamy mouthfeel. Beer heaven.
Poured deep dark brown with no head. Aroma of vanilla sweetness, alcohol soaked fruit. Full body, flavour is sweet and fruity, toffee, dark fruit. Lingering sweetness.
alcohol, woody, vanilla, roasty, black, very bitter, medium sweetness, thick feel, oily feel, full body, soft carbonation,

Bottle from brewdog online
Rich and warming but gentle on the bourbon character allowing the base beer to come through, rich, dark, fruity, some vanilla and butterscotch, thick with low carbonation and a long warming finish.
On tap at the Shack during beer week, chocolate, bourbon aroma, effervescent.
2010 bottle. Black with tiny tan head. Strong aromas of chocolate and bourbon. Chocolatey flavor with a strong alcohol finish. Very smooth. Pretty damn good beer.

375ml bottle shared by Phil @ Crossroads Spirits. Thanks Phil! Poured a thick oily black color with a small foamy tan head. Big boozy bourbon aroma, some oak, caramel, and dark fruit as well. Taste is much the same. Lots of bourbon and oak, and notes of toffee, roasted malt, and sweet dark fruits.

2013 bottle. Sharp nose of hot bourbon, plums, some cherries, and surprisingly a bit of oxidation. Pours a murky black with brown accents accompanied by a brief dark espresso head. Boozy bourbon and cherries dominate the taste (the alcohol is quite hot and burns throughout the sips). Light chocolate, some roasted malt, and biscuit, and peanut butter manages to sneak through the booze. Thin body for a beer with "Viscosity" in the name, with a oily texture and sharp, hot finish. Not bad, but it seems I opened this one too soon.
A great beer. Plenty of bourbon and alcohol throughout. Some subtle smokiness as well.

Botella de 37.5 cl en el lúpulo, en el momento el 12-02-2014. Increíbles aromas a madera de Barril de bourbon y frutas pasas, caramelo y mucho licor. Con sabores a madera y mas madera de barriles de bourbon muy intensos y ligeramente quemados, con toques dulces (frutas del bosque, uvas y ciruelas pasas, ) y final seco también de madera y amargo bastante duradero. Sensación alcohólica muy intensa con 12 vol que se notan de principio a fin. Alucinante cerveza increíble. De las mejores de la marca hasta el momento. Alucinante muy buena.

Je mattendais à voir un liquide aussi épais que de la vieille huile à moteur. Or, ça ressemble à un porter classique et ça ne mousse pas fort, sauf quon peut la ranimer un peu. Ça sent les fruits secs, les raisins et les dattes en particulier. Ya aussi des arômes boisés, de mélasse, herbacés avec des vapeurs dalcool. Cest assez sucré en bouche. La mélasse, qui précède le café-crème avec des saveurs de chocolat noir, pas des plus forts en pourcentage de cacao. Une bonne amertume tape sur le palais et prend un certain temps à dégouliner. Lalcool est des plus réconfortant finalement. Vintage 2013 (979-200114)

Bottle. Pours thick, opaque black with minimal head. Smells very strongly of bourbon, booze, and smoke. The taste is vanilla and dark fruit upfront with a boozy, burning finish and just the tiniest hint of smoke. The bourbon character and alcohol punch increase as the beer warms up. Delicious, but not for beginners.
375ml bottle at Hoppy pub Thessaloniki. Black color withe small beige head. Roasted malty aroma with chocolate, a little coffee and wood/bourbon. Taste is the same as aroma, sweeter and more intense.
Bottle from Watson. Pours motor oil black with no head. Aroma of oak and booze. Taste of raisins, oak, and bourbon. Definitely doesnt hold back.

Bottle 2013 vintage. Dark almost pitch black pour with a thin mocha head. Vanialla, oak, roasted nuts, espresso, raisin, dried fruits. Full body (can probably use a spoon) with just enough carbonation to make this lively yet tasty. Soft and smooth tar finish. A long finish.

2013 vinatage, aged properly. Pours a near black color with fairly little head on it. Nose is quite complex... I get a lot of darker fruits in there, most notably fig and raisin, with a little bit of bourbon subtly coming through underneath the fruit. The bourbon comes through stronger in the taste, and I find it slightly boozy like that. There is a bit of sweetness coming through, with just a hint of burnt elements, and a slight chocolate finish. Complex and quite interesting...

Woof, this one is a big complex beer not for the faint hearted. Pours an opaque red to black in the tulip glass, no head, aroma of booze, banana, flowers, dark fruit, a real mix bag here. The first sip, truly a sip, was burn and mulled wine. Once it warmed and opened up a little, the bourbon came through big time, this isnt an easy beer to drink but it is enjoyable.

Poured 2013B vintage from bottld to glass. Jet black hue with tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, oak, vanilla, toffee, raisins, cola.mouthfeel is thick with a full body and average carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout but overly cloying. Bitter astringtness following and an ethanol finish. Overall this is a spectacular brew.

Pours black with tan head. Smells sweet and bourbon like. Taste very mellow and smooth for the alcohol content. Very sweet, woody, caramel, and bourbon taste. Slightly alcohol burn in aftertaste. Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pours black flat and oily top. Aroma is sweet oaky raisins, taste is sweet booze up front and a bit of an alcohol burn. While the booze isn't overwhelming, it could use some more bitterness
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. pours a thick viscous very dark color. Boozy sweet dark fruity aroma. Roasty dark fruit boozy flavor. Very tasty.
1/15/2014. From bottle. Pours pitch black with a small beige head. Sweet oaky aromas with roasted malt and dark fruit. Flavors are complex with oak, chocolate, licorice. Almost no carbonation.

Guest tap at FFF poured into snifter. Appearance is deep brown with no translucent edges. A small tan head forms, then collapses to a thin remnant that lasts the session - which took a while. This was a textbook sipper. The aroma is barrel-forward: coconut, charred oak, vanilla, brown sugar, and booze. Below that are coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, and ripe plum. Taste is lead by toasted coconut and the barrel notes - all washed in alcohol. Moderate sweetness comes next in the form of vanilla, molasses, and chocolate. Some bitter licorice and oak flavors come late. Full bodied, thick, oily, and chewy texture, minimal carbonation, long sweet boozy finish.

Bottle, 2012. Black with tiny mocha head - yep, looks viscous. Heavy sweet bourbon nose, chocolate, caramel and thick syrupy dark fruit too. Bourbon is big in the taste, plenty of cocoa, figs, and sweet caramel. Some thicker roastier coffee comes through, decent dark roast malt. Full bodied, a sipper. Booze well integrated. Sweet bourbon lingers with a touch of dark chocolate. Pricey, but excellent.

Appearance: Cork-n-caged. Basically black, oily. Minimal head.
Aroma: Oak, whiskey, wood.
Taste: Lots of whiskey, wood, slightly roasted. Warming, some alcohol. Bourbon-barreling a bit overpowering. Overrated.
Info: 375ml bottle, 28/12-2013
Bottle into glass . pitch black pout with hardely any brown head.. very strong chocolate vanilla aroma, and taste, would like more carbonation, pretty flat, but still amazing, especially for the ABV

Dark brown almost black with a brownish head quickly fading. Intense aromas of blackstrap molasses, tar, soy sauce. Hint of a carbonation, almost full bodied, sweet, alcohol, burnt sugar palate. Finishes with a light astringency. Great sipper!
Pours black with minimal head from corked and caged bottle. Nose of sweet vanilla and malt. Taste is sweet bourbon and vanilla. Some alchy burn.

Shared a bottle with benzai @ benzai. Pitch black with no head at all. Smells sweet, wood, bourbon, nuts, roasty, chocolate, praline. Tastes sweet, roasty, almond, wood, bourbon, chocolate, praline.. Lovely beer. Full body, quite a lot of alcohol but not bothering, soft carbo. Amazing beer. Worth my 15 euro.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 22.12.2013, 0,375l bottle (2009 vintage) @ home:
No head, completely flat. Aroma is rich and sweet, mild bourbon, vanilla, dark sugar, dark malts, licorice, caramel, dark chocolate. Taste is slightly sweet, mild bourbon, licorice, dark sugar, dark malts, vanilla, oak, caramel, Medium bitterness "flat" mouthfeel. Very nice, even though the lack of carbonation, and therefore also a nice brown head, is kind of a turnoff compared to other similar beers.

Bottled 2011

Yet again, Im allured to the potential of Tomme. Deep breath.

A: Pull the cage off the cork and give the cork a firm twist and tug, the bitch barely moves. Finally work it off to an underwhelming "oop" of cork expanding out the mouth of the bottle. Pours out a dark, dark maduro ale with a sheet of transient cocoa foam. The foam disappears in a few seconds to leave a rim of the same bordering a mirrored surface over this darky. No lace. 

S: Oak, licorice, black cherry, molasses and dark malts. Some sweet bourbon notes. Kinda has a cake smell on it.

T: Hot as hell. The alcohol is the first thing I notice. Then toasted cocoa and coffee alongside some vanilla notes and just a whiff of coconut. Some nice bourbon tones. Really, really potent. 

M: Thick and viscous (fancy that), carbonated (fancy that!!), an oddly sticky yet dry finish. 

O: So heres the thing, I can drink this, and would say its a decent beer. I would argue it is overpriced compared to similar beers. The barrels really come through stronger than I prefer, but they are exactly that - barrels previously having held alcohol. Would I drink again? Absolutely. Will I purchase another bottle? If I find one at the same price ($17/375ml) that is at least two years old then I will. Otherwise, this one can sit on the shelves.

Serving type: bottle

09-06-2011

On tap 5 oz. pour at the 2013 Strong Ale Festival at Pizza Port in Carlsbad (village), CA. 

Opaque, near black with a thin tan head and good lacing. 

Aroma of molasses, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. 

Taste of roasted malt and molasses. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Three Floyds. Black with a foamy brown head. Big bourbon and marshmallow aroma with booze. Taste is full of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, with a boozy finish. Delicious. Body is thick like a milkshake.

Blurs the line between a Strong Ale and a Stout. Definite bourbon flavor from the aging. Yet smooth and balanced for 12%Abv. Not boozy at all. Just plan good. Sip and savor!! Expensive and worth it. Simply a great beer to experience and enjoy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a corked pint bottle purchased at Port Brewery/Lost Abbey deep brown black with a thin tan head.
Aroma of bourbon. 
Taste is roasted malted cocoa with strong alcohol burn that is totally warming while wonderful. 
This is one thick delicious mouth feel. Sweetness is strong but the bourbon finish makes pretty much perfect.
Overall this will be in my top 10 of great brews consumed in 2013. Wished Port had not limited our buy to only one.

Bottle @ home. Very dark brown, small tan head that settles nicely, good lacing. Aroma, malty, milk chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, caramel, quite boozy, toffee, . Taste, malty, roasted notes, chocolate, vanilla, wood, tobacco, bourbon, leather, dark fruits. Warming boozy end. Great aftertaste of bourbon and malt.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured a black color with no head. The aroma was of molasses, bourbon, chocolate, syrup and spices. The taste was on the bourbon/booze side with caramel, dark fruit and molasses. Well done.

375 ml bottle bought through Brill & Co. Pours black with a very small dark chocolate brown head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace worth mentioning. Smell is sweet, malty and boozy with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, caramelized almonds, bourbon, brandy, sweet liquorice candy, charred wood, leather, moist soil, blueberry glazed doughnuts and subtle hints if chlorine. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and boozy with toasted malts, caramel, biscuits, toffee, cocoa powder, charred wood, brandy, bourbon, rum soaked raisins, vanilla fudge, roasted nuts, leather, sweet dark bread, moist soil, hay, blueberry jam and dried pine needles. Mouthfeel is round, slightly sticky sweet, tiny creamy, boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet, bitter and malty with caramel, toffee, bourbon, rum soaked raisins, charred wood, vanilla fudge, moist soil and leather. Very good but for some reasons I expected more. Especially the mouthfeel feels a bit off being surprisingly light bodied and boozy.

Schwarz, ohne schaum, aroma angenehm nach bourbon-fasslagerung, nicht zu stark, sehr gut ausgewogen im geschmack, leicht alkoholnote, schokokade, kaffe, feinbitter und kaffee im nachklang

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A- pours a heavy, opaque oily black with the faintest of medium khaki head that quickly dissipates. S- aromas of oak, raisin bread, dog food grains, caramel malts, molasses are ripe. Alcohol is also nice. Some vanilla, rhubarb, mince meat pie and prunes. M- relatively medium watery body for such a heavy beer with a sticky medium palate that has some bite on the end. Light carbonation. T- caramel, bourbon, molasses and bread are first. Some earthiness and vegetal notes in the middle with root beer, zinc and vanilla. Ending is more alcohol, raisins, grains and mineral water. Aftertaste is long and slightly stinging.

Solid black with no head. Aroma is soy sauce, liquorice, molasses, bourbon, chocolate, earthy mushrooms, hint of vanilla. Oily, viscous mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a load of umami and a hint of roast, balanced booziness on the finish. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, soy sauce, liquorice, fig, molasses, raisins, hint of oak. This is the kind of beer I live for.

Pour an inky black with no head. The nose is soy sauce, bourbon, vanilla and date. The pallet starts with caramel malt and molasses followed by vanilla, date, booze, cocoa nib and finishes with a balanced bourbon and oak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oily pitch black pour with very minimal head. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, licorice, chocolate. Big, mouth-warming mouthfeel. Nice alcohol heat all the way down. Bitter chocolate/cocoa at the finish. Great sipper.

Corked & Caged 375 ml Bottle. Naturally a sludgy black motor oil pour with no head. Mostly bittersweet chocolate, coconut, dark fruit and bourbon notes in the aroma. The taste delivers a healthy serving of bourbon, roasted malt and espresso in addition to some dark chocolate and molasses toward the end. A relatively viscous body with low carbonation leads to a charred whiskey finish. The bourbon notes seamlessly blend with the Old Viscosity base. Great stuff.

375ml bottle from Ales by Mail
2011 vintage - Pours pitch black with a tiny white head. Lovely aroma of smooth bourbon notes, roasted malts, oak, wood, vanilla and syrup. Taste is smooth, warming, sweet and slightly roasty with loads of bourbon, oak, wood, vanilla and syrupy notes, hints of chocolate and coffee. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and lingering bitter with some long lasting warming vinous bourbon notes, oak, wood, vanilla, chocolate and caramel.
